title.narrative: Emergency shelter and NFI assistance to IDPs in Borno through direct distribution and strengthening of the shelter and NFI sector pipeline

description.narrative:
The complex emergency and conflict in North East Nigeria started in 2009 and has resulted in the displacement of over 2 million people (DTM Aug 2019). Overall, 7.1 million people are in dire need of assistance across Borno, Adamawa and Yobe (BAY) states (HRP 2019-2021), including 1.9 million IDPs targeted by shelter and CCCM sector. The situation of IDPs is critical, as they are living in emergency shelters in severely congested temporary camps and in harsh weather conditions prone to frequent disasters such as rain, flooding and fire incidents.
Due to increased hostilities and insecurity, the number of registered displacements continue to increase (by 2% over last 4 months’ period), and is expected to continue, as the Nigerian Government Forces recently adopted the strategy of establishing “super camps” to strengthen their defenses in areas with population concentration, thereby removing troops from remote areas. This strategy will result in further displacements of IDPs, moving to secure locations, and therefore to an increased demand in shelter.
Due to ongoing conflict and security operation in Borno, 5 Local Government Areas - LGAs (Guzamala, Marte, Kukawa, Abadam and Kala/Balge) are indeed considered completely inaccessible while 8 more LGAs – Bama, Damboa, Dikwa, Gwoza, Konduga, Monguno, Ngala and Nganzai - are considered “hard to reach” or partially accessible, with the least access to health services, shelters, safe water and the highest rate of malnutrition and protection issues (REACH - November 2018 - April 2019).
Through this project, Solidarites International (SI) is thus proposing to strengthen the humanitarian response capacity in terms of shelter and NFIs by providing 2,580 Bama emergency shelters (aligned with the Shelter Cluster standard) and 2,580 improved NFI kits to approximately 18,060 beneficiaries (7 beneficiaries per NFI kit on average). Of these shelters, 1,700 emergency shelters and 1,700 improved NFI kits will be pre-positioned as part of the shelter sector pipeline managed by the Shelter and CCCM sector in IOM warehouse in Maiduguri and common warehouses in Monguno, Dikwa and Ngala (prioritized locations under this allocation). This pre-positioning will ensure that they will be ready to be distributed to fasten the humanitarian response. Additionally, 880 emergency shelters (Bama) and NFI kits will be directly distributed by SI to new arrivals and vulnerable households in need of shelters replacement/upgrading in the targeted areas.
Thus, the beneficiaries of the proposed action are key shelter and NFI humanitarian actors working in Borno State and responding to the ongoing humanitarian crisis, as well as 18,060 IDPs
